thread.title: Congressional Republicans May Not Fund Trump’s Border Wall
thread.title_full: Congressional Republicans May Not Fund Trump’s Border Wall

author: Randy DeSoto
title: Congressional Republicans May Not Fund Trump’s Border Wall
text:
Ryan Won’t Ask Nunes To Step Aside From Probe Of Russian Meddling In Election 
“All of the committees, House and Senate leaderships, are working together to try to finalize the rest of the FY17 bill,” said Sen. Roy Blunt, R-Mo., a senior member of the Appropriations Committee. “My guess is that comes together better without the supplemental” for the border wall. Funding for Trump's border wall with Mexico likely to be put on hold https://t.co/jOnOPYWJ19 pic.twitter.com/RNzMq2vIzp 
— The Hill (@thehill) March 28, 2017 
Raising the debt ceiling is also wrapped up in the funding negotiations, and Republican leadership fears if funding for the border wall is included, Democrats will force a government shut down, Politico reports . Advertisement - story continues below 
As with last week’s health care law, Republicans can afford to lose only approximately 22 members in the House. Additionally, they must pick up a least eight Democrats in the Senate to pass the spending bill. 
Senate Majority Whip John Cornyn, R-Texas, told the news outlet, “There’s not going to be a shutdown.” 
As for funding the wall? 
“ It remains to be seen,” Cornyn said. “What I would like to see is a plan for how the money would be spent and a good-faith discussion about what border security is really composed of. We haven’t had that.” Advertisement - story continues below
